data.title: Every Artist Wants a Feature From Ty Dolla $ign â€” These Are His Best Collabs of All Time
data.meta_description: Ty Dolla $ign gave us an entire era of music that can only be described as unforgettable. Here are some of his top-ranking collaborations over the years.
data.text:
Ty Dolla $ign gave us an entire era of music that can only be described as unforgettable. Here are some of his top-ranking collaborations over the years.

By S.Y.

Oct. 6 2023, Updated 4:01 p.m. ET

A Ty Dolla $ign feature is worth its weight in RIAA-certified gold. Over the years, he's worked with many artists, from Kanye West and Future to FKA Twigs and Dreamville's Ari Lennox.

He's carved a niche for himself as one of the most sought-after guest artists in the game, and it's not hard to see why. His distinct voice has the ability to instantly make a record more compelling.

Calling this artist a hitmaker would be an understatement. If you're not convinced, read on for a list of our favorite Ty Dolla $ign features of all time!

"Work From Home" with Fifth Harmony

Ty Dolla $ign's collaboration with then-girl group Fifth Harmony resulted in the infectious hit "Work from Home." His smooth vocals blended seamlessly with the group's harmonies, skyrocketing the song to the top of the charts. It became a summer anthem and showcased Ty's ability to successfully crossover into pop music.

Article continues below advertisement

"Hot Girl Summer" with Megan Thee Stallion and Nicki Minaj

When people talk about the record "Hot Girl Summer," they hardly mention Ty's addition to the sizzling summer track alongside two of the hottest female rappers in the industry. His catchy hook added a memorable element to the song, which largely contributed to its chart-topping success.

"Hot Girl Summer" became an anthem for empowerment and fun. The track solidified Ty's reputation as a go-to collaborator.

"Psycho" with Post Malone

Another song that showcased Ty's versatility was "Psycho" with Post Malone. This song demonstrated his range as an artist and highlighted his lyrical prowess.

As to be expected, the collab was a hit.

The song's success solidified Ty's status as a superstar in the making. "Psycho" may have been released a few years ago, but in the words of the internet, "it still slaps." The music video was also a hit with fans and has one billion views to date.

Article continues below advertisement

"Swalla" with Jason Derulo and Nicki Minaj

Ty Dolla $ign joined forces with Jason Derulo and Nicki Minaj for "Swalla," a groovy, catchy, and danceable track that took over the airwaves. Although Nicki and Jason held their own on the single, Ty's vocals elevated the song and made it a chart-topping success.

"OTW" with Khalid and 6lack

"OTW" features Ty Dolla $ign alongside the uber-talented Khalid and 6lack. The trio's smooth vocals and harmonies were a prime example of R&B excellence.

The track was critically acclaimed and solidified Ty's reputation as an artist who can effortlessly switch between genres.

Article continues below advertisement

"Or Nah" The Weeknd, Wiz Khalifa, and DJ Mustard

"Or Nah" demonstrated Ty Dolla $ign's ability to hop on a track and leave listeners wanting more.

On this song, Ty teamed up with The Weeknd, Wiz Khalifa, and DJ Mustard. His seductive vocals added a provocative edge to the song. Unsurprisingly, "Or Nah" has garnered over 708 million views and counting on YouTube!

"Ego Death" with Kanye West, FKA Twigs, and Skrillex

Ty Dolla, $ign's collaboration with Kanye West, FKA Twigs, and Skrillex on "Ego Death," displayed his experimental side.

The song's EDM and hip-hop edge exemplified Ty's signature approach to music: pushing boundaries and exploring new sounds.
